I say to you  and you'll understand that it is a privilege to fight!

speaker: Dwight
line: You can't. You can't. But I promise I'll never betray you again. What can I do, Michael. What can I do?  What can I do?  What can I do? What can I do?

speaker: Michael
line: You can get up. Get up.  And you can hug it out, bitch.

title: The Coup
speaker: Michael
line: Hug it out, bitch. That is what men say to each other, after a fight. They hug it out, and doing so, the just... let it go. And walk away. And they're done. Not a good idea to say that to a woman however. I have found. It doesn't translate.

title: The Coup
speaker: Michael
line: Yep. Yeah, we hugged it out. But, it turns out, I was still a little angry. So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more,  and I'm making him do my laundry for a year.

line: Okay that's enough.

speaker: Michael
line: Well, you know what? I didn't wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can't stop picturing it. He leaves work, he's on his way home... wham! His cappa is detated from his head!

title: Grief Counseling
speaker: Stanley
line: You have just spit on my face.

title: Grief Counseling
speaker: Michael
line: Well, you know what? There's something wrong with you. There is something wrong with everybody in here. Because we have lost a member of our family and you don't wanna talk about it, you don't wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!

title: Grief Counseling
speaker: Michael
line: There are five stages to grief, which are  denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance. And right now, out there, they're all denying the fact that they're sad. And that's hard. And it's making them all angry. And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance. And if not acceptance, then just depression. If I can get them depressed, then I'll have done my job.

title: Grief Counseling
speaker: Michael
line: I am going to throw you this ball. When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged. Let me just start. Let me show you how this works. I catch the ball. I lost Ed Truck. And... it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears... and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer... and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone... and I'm crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly... terribly alone.

line: Okay, fine. Hurry back.

line: Hi, yeah. This is Mike from the West Side Market. Well, we get a shipment of Herr's salt and vinegar chips, and we ordered that about three weeks ago and haven't ... . yeah. You have 'em in the warehouse. Great. What is my store number... six. Wait, no. I'll call you back.  Shut up .

line: I got it. When my mother was pregnant with me, they did an ultrasound and found she was having twins. When they did another ultrasound a few weeks later, they discovered, that I had resorbed the other fetus. Do I regret this? No. I believe his tissue has made me stronger. I now have the strength of a grown man and a little baby.

line: Okay, why don't you throw the ball to somebody else.

line: Let's see. I had an aunt that I was really close to. She was this amazing female boxer. Um, anyway, she was injured in a fight, and she was paralyzed. So, you can imagine how upset I was when I found out that she asked her manager to remove her breathing tube so she could die.

title: Grief Counseling
speaker: Michael
line: Wow. If you wanna cry, that's okay.

speaker: Ryan
line: Thanks. Um, a few years ago, my family was on a safari in Africa and, um, my cousin, Mufasa was um, he was trampled to death by a pack of wildebeests and, um, we all... took it really hard. All of us kind of in the audience of what happened.

line: Do you want to talk about it anymore?

line: Oh, it would probably take me like an hour and a half to tell that whole story.

line: Me, me, me, me, me me.  Yes. Okay, um. I was trying to throw this party once. And everyone was over for the weekend. And then my uncle Bernie died, and so me and my best friend, we had to pretend like he was alive, so...

line: Wait a second. That's Weekend at Bernie's.  Do you think that this is a game?

line: All right, we're starting over.

line: Oh, God!

line: Oh...

line: Oh shhhh--oot!

line: He is a goner.

line: Yeah.

line: Attention everybody. This will only take a second of your time. Today at 4 p.m. we will be meeting in the parking lot to have a funeral service for this bird.

line: Don't hurt me! Baby, don't hurt me!

line: Oh!

line: Baby, don't hurt me!

line: Oh! Oh! Oh!

line: Whoa-oh-oh-oh

line: Scuse me! Scuse me!

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy & Michael
line: Whoa-oh-oh-oh! Whoa-oh-oh...

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You me? You me? Me you? You! You! You me! Bow Bow Bow!

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Whoa-oh-oh-oh.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You me? You me? Me you me! You! You! You me you! You! Oh my nose so itchy, why's my nose so itchy!

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Oh, probably because of all the nose candy.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Okay, I told you these guys had a sense of humor.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Very funny, Michael!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Okay! Okay!

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Really funny, Michael!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: All right, all right, I'm on a roll.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Why are the new people on the table? To show them that we are not above them.

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Shouldn't we be equals?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Not today. No. Tony! Please join your cohorts on the table if you would.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Uh... this is difficult, for me.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: I understand. We're all friends.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: No. I mean I can't physically. I can't get on the table.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Oh, well. Just use the momentum of your lower half to hoist yourself up.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You know what? I'll help. I will...

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: No, please. No.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Don't be shy! Dwight! Let's do this!

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Do this. Come on. Ready?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Come on. We're doing this thing! Let's get up.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: On three. One... two... three.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Bend at the knees. Okay, here we go. Here we go. I'm under this... I'm under this hock here. I don't know what I'm grabbing here.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: All right. All right. Stop. Put me down.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: We've almost got it. Push it! Push it!

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Let me go!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: I'm right in your crack!

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Put me down right...

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Up and over.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Put me down!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Up and over.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Put me down right now!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You've got it.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: I'VE HAD ENOUGH!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You've got it, you've got it.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: PUT ME DOWN RIGHT NOW or else!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Whoa Whoa Whoa! Okay.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Hey, hey. Easy.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Easy.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: I'm sorry!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Don't...

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: It's just not going to work for me.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: What...

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: I have to go.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: I don't understand.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: I was on the fence about this and... it's just not a good fit.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Well, we'll squeeze you in.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: I can't work here. I have to quit.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You can't quit! On the first day. That's  heresy, my friend!  Okay, let's talk about this. What happened? I mean, what... Was it Toby? Did he say something? Cause he's... what?

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: No. Toby was helpful. He was very kind. It's just your management style.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: My management style? So... didn't you think 'Lazy Scranton' was funny?

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: No. Was it supposed to be funny?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Okay. Well, don't bother quitting because you're fired.

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: Excuse me?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: You are fired! I'm sorry, but we don't have quitters on this team! Just clean out your desk!

title: The Merger
speaker: Tony
line: But there's nothing in my desk except coupons.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Don't try to apologize to me, man! It's too late. Just get out! Take your bad vibes with you.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: That was my advice. Remember? I'm the one who suggested that you fire him.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Probably the best advice you ever gave me, Dwight.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: And what advice has Andy given to you today that you have acted on? Would 'none' be an accurate estimate? None advice?  Fire Andy. Fire. Andy.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Dwight may have won the battle. But I will win... the next battle.

title: The Merger
speaker: Hannah
line: Tony was right. This environment is dysfunctional.

title: The Merger
speaker: Angela
line: Maybe that's because some people treat it like their own private Hooters strip club.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.

title: The Merger
speaker: Stanley
line: Back to work. We don't have to get along. We just have to work together.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: No. We do have to get along. Can't we all just get along? Or have we forgotten the words of the Reverend King.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: What!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Yeah! They punk'd us! They punk'd us good! Come on. Come on!

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Does Bob Vance work for Vance Refrigeration?

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Does he ever.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: YEAH!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Yeah.

title: The Merger
speaker: Toby
line: I don't... I don't think we can do that.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Go home, Toby. Just...

title: The Merger
speaker: Martin
line: Hey! Why doesn't your car have a flat tire?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Why? I will tell you why. Because they saved the worst for me. They put a hate note under my windshield wiper. Check this out. It's so hateful.  "You guys SUCK! You can never pull together as one and revenge us. That is why you SUCK!"

title: The Merger
speaker: Hannah
line: For crying out loud.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: No. No, no, no. No. You are falling for it. You're playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don't, oh...

title: The Merger
speaker: Martin
line: What's up with this guy?

title: The Merger
speaker: Stanley
line: Got an hour? I'll try to explain.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: THIS IS EGREGIOUS! This is egregious!

title: The Merger
speaker: Stanley
line: Trust me. It only gets worse.

title: The Merger
speaker: Martin
line: Is he always like this?

title: The Merger
speaker: Ryan
line: Sometimes he brings more costumes.

title: The Merger
speaker: Hannah
line: When do people work?

title: The Merger
speaker: Phyllis
line: Oh, we find little times during the day.

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: How are we going to get home?

title: The Merger
speaker: Phyllis
line: Bob Vance has an air pump. He said he'd fill all our tires up.

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Bob Vance of Vance Refrigeration.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: See that? Mission accomplished. Like a bunch of fourth graders. Sometimes, what brings the kids together is hating the lunch lady. Although that'll change. Because, by the end of the fourth grade, the lunch lady was actually the person I hung out with the most.  Jell-o!

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: Michael!

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Hi, Jan!

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: Did you fire Tony Gardner when he was trying to quit?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: I did. Major personnel crises averted. Compliment accepted.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: Do you realize, Michael, that we now have to pay him severance?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Yes.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: You do?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: But do you realize that that was actually Dwight's idea? Bad advice from my Number Two.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: What? No. No. No, Jim is your Number Two.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: What?

title: The Merger
speaker: Jan
line: He's the only one who has worked with both groups. I sent you a memo about this.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Yes, I know that. For, I do read the memos.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: So after a great deal of thought and introspective-shun, I have decided to make Jim my new Number Two.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: If he even wants it. It doesn't come with a pay raise.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Yeah, it does, actually.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: So who will be your new Number Three?

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Uh... that I have not decided yet.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Michael, I would just like to say you have handled this entire situation with great aplomb.

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Thank you, Andy. That's... very kind. Thanks.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: And I have to say your leadership...

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Shut it...

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: has brought...

title: The Merger
speaker: Michael
line: Shut it! That's...  suck up!

speaker: Jim
line: Hey! Where you at, Filippelli?

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: I'm at the grocery store buying a corkscrew to give myself a lobotomy.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: What's wrong? You didn't have a good first day?

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Oh my god! Hey! You want to meet at Cooper's in an hour? I need a drink.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Yeah. Sure. Sounds good. I... .  Hey! You know what? Can I give you a call right back?

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Yeah.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Ok, thanks.

title: The Merger
speaker: Karen
line: Ok.

speaker: Jim
line: Hey.

speaker: Pam
line: Hey!

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: I thought you had already... left.

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: Uh... no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Oh... Good.

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: What's up?

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Oh, nothing. I just feel bad. I feel like things were a little weird today... or something.

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: What do you mean?

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: I just think I should tell you that... I've sort of started seeing someone. And uh...

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: Oh. That's totally cool. You can do whatever you want.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: O..ok. Um..good.

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: We're friends. We'll always be friends.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Right.

title: The Merger
speaker: Pam
line: It's good to have you back.

title: The Merger
speaker: Jim
line: Yeah. Good to be back.

title: The Merger
speaker: Meredith
line: Where'd you get that salad?

title: The Merger
speaker: Kevin
line: Staples.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Saw your dorkmobile in the parking lot. What does it get, like four miles to the gallon?

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Uh, try double that. Classic TransAm, vintage American muscle. Please.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Yeah, my Xterra's pretty sweet. Luxurious, yet rugged. Leave it to the Japanese.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Xterra's not even a real word.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Actually, it is. It's Latin for "earth."

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Oh, so you drive an X-Earth?

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Yeah.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: That makes sense. I'd rather drive a classic TransAm than an XEarth.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Yeah, I bet you would. Oh, by the way, 1985 called. It wants its car back.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Well I hope 1985 has a time machine 'cause I drive an 87.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Oh, speaking of time machines, I just got back from the future and I went to your funeral and, guess what, nobody came.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Speaking of funerals, why don't you go ahead and go die.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Oh, that was a really well constructed sentence. You should be an English professor at Cor-not University.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: Idiot!

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: If I were an idiot, I'd be driving a TransAm.

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: If you were driving a TransAm, you would be the smartest idiot in the whole world.

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Idiot!

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: You're the idiot!

title: The Merger
speaker: Andy
line: Nice comeback!

title: The Merger
speaker: Dwight
line: I was making fun of your comeback! That's why it worked.  Totally got the best of that interchange.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Ohhhh! She's absolutely adorable!

title: The Convict
speaker: Hannah
line: He.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: ...Oh, sorry. He's--he's dressed all in pink.

line: That's his favorite color.

title: The Convict

line: ...Oh. That's... fun for him.

line: Fantastic.

speaker: Michael
line: Ohhh, wow. Look at that. How cute.

title: The Convict
speaker: Hannah
line: Thank youuu.

speaker: Michael
line: Ohh. May I?

title: The Convict
speaker: Hannah
line: Uh, sure!

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Hey, look at me, I'm a baby! I'm one of those babies from "Look Who's Talking." What am I thinking?  Look at all those staplers! What's a stapler!? I don't even know, I'm a baby! Hey, Mom, I'm thirsty! I'm thirsty, Mama! I want some milk. And you know where milk comes from! Breasts.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Hey.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Hey.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: ...Almost done?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Just about... yup. Now.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Yes. I have started to see Karen. It's very new, and... not really ready to talk about it openly yet, just because, I think, once the word gets out there, it might affect the way people behave around us or... I dunno. Just, not yet.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Yeah, Jan, it um... looks like a check, piece of paper of some sort. Receipt. I don't know.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Jan, this is Angela Martin from accounting.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: Mmhmm.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Look, we have a rebate from... the Federal Work Opportunity Program and no one knows what that means.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: We get that money for hiring an ex-convict.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: I didn't hire an ex-convict. Unless they mean Toby. Convicted rapist.  ... I'm just kidding.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: When did the check come?

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Last week.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: Okay, that's when the branches merged, so Josh must have been taking advantage of this program. Smart move.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: One of the Stamford people is a criminal?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Hey Jan, speaking of Stamford, Hannah brought in her baby.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Jan, which one of the new employees is a criminal?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: Uh, reformed convict, and, uh, I'm not sure. Though hang on, let me email our HR, stay on the line.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Who is it?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Hannah?

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Hmm.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Hmm.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Andy.

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Andy?

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Hmm. Martin?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Kuhhhh... you are such a racist.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Wait, why am I a racist?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Because you think he's black.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: He is black... right? And...

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Stop it. Stop it right-stop it right now.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: ...Okay it's someone named Martin Nash.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Yeah!

title: The Convict
speaker: Jan
line: Michael?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Why did the convict have to be a black guy? It is such a stereotype. I just wish that Josh had made a more progressive choice. Like a white guy... who went to prison for... polluting a black guy's lake.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: I wonder what he did.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: In our society, a black man can be arrested for almost anything. He was probably at a sporting event and... saw some people pushing each other, and he intervened.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Why would anyone go to jail for that?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Sssssso, what we need to do... is to forget about this whole Martin in prison thing. People will draw unfair conclusions about Martin and or black people.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Cool.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Okay. Angela?

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Sure. Let's protect the convicts. At the expense of the general feeling of safety in the workplace. As a 90-pound female that sits in an ill-lit, rarely-visited corner of the office, naturally I agree with that.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Good. All right.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Jim Halpert.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: I am so horny.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: ...Okay I can't... help you... with that.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Oh, I think you can, Big Tuna. Tell me about that Indian chick, Kelly. She seems pretty slutty. Good for a romp in the sack.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: She is dating Ryan, I think.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Oh, and I care why?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: She's... high-maintenance.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Next. How about... . Blondes are more fun. C'mon, trust me on that.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Yeah, trust me, that would be fun for no one.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Okay fine. Um. Pam, the receptionist. Paaam. Should I go for it?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: ...Absolutely you should.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Jackpot.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Just... try to be cool.

title: The Convict
speaker: Dwight
line: I am cool.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Okay, are you cool, really?

title: The Convict
speaker: Dwight
line: I'm cool, I'm cool, I'm so cool. Tell me what is going on.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Um... Martin, from Stamford, was, at one time, in prison.  No. Dwight! Be cool! Be cool!

title: The Convict
speaker: Dwight
line: I am greatly concerned about having a convict in the office. And I do not care if that convict is white, black, Asian, German, or some kind of halfsy. I do not like criminals.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: All... righty, let's get started. What is she into?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: I know Pam pretty well. I know the things that she likes, and, just as important, I know the things that she hates. So, one of the things that she likes is pranks. And, the things that she hates...

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Frisbee-based competitions...

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Are you kidding?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: She...

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: I started the main Frisbee golf club at Cornell. Where I went to college. I live to frolf.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Lead off with that. She loves hunting. She also loves those ads for Six Flags, with the old guy.  Got it. Also... do you speak pig latin?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Hey Martin, how's it going?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Good. Getting settled, you know?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Ah. Good good. Good. Just a second. Everybody? May I have your attention please? I realize that a lot of you have already heard that Martin here has had some trouble with the law, but I just want to declare publicly that I... trust... him, completely, and that anybody who doesn't is an ignorant, dumb... person. Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: My dad.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: ...Danny Glover.  Yeah.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Jonas Salk.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Who?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Justin Timberlake?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Oh. Please. Colin Powell.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Hey I got one.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Yup.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Jesus.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Apollo Creed.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Close your eyes. Picture a convict. What's he wearing? Nothing special, baseball cap on backwards, baggy pants... he says something ordinary like... 'yo, thats shizzle.' Okay. Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: So... you all wanna know what I was in for?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: No. That's not cool. You don't have to tell them.

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Um, I really don't mind. It was a stupid mistake. I was working in finance and, I... got involved in some insider trading. So, I spent a little time in the clink.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: That is awesome.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: I had Martin explain to me three times what he got arrested for, because... it sounds an awful lot like what I do here every day.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: What was prison like?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Not terrible. Boring. We do the same thing every day. But... at least we got outdoors time.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: You got outdoors time?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Two hours, every day. Sometimes we'd play pickup football games...

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Michael, why don't we get outdoors time?

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Yeah, some days I never go outside.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Well, we are running a business, so.

title: The Convict
speaker: Meredith
line: What was your cell like?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Not good. Uh... a little bit bigger than Michael's office... but, you know, I really only slept there. You know, during the day, there-our time's our own. They had uh, classes, I took some... watercolor classes.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: They have art classes?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Yeap. Yeah.

title: The Convict
speaker: Ryan
line: They have business classes there?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: They did, taught by some uh, Harvard business school guys--a lot of the guys also, that were in the class, the inmates, a lot of them have gone on to do extraordinary things in business.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Kinda sounds like... prison's... better than Dunder-Mifflin.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Ah. Well. That's not true.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: I would so rather be in prison.

title: The Convict
speaker: Ryan
line: Prison sounds great.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: No you would not.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: This place is not prison. It's... way better than prison.

title: The Convict
speaker: Creed
line: Baby. Hello baby. Here you want to play with this?

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: You can't give paperclips to a baby. He could swallow.

title: The Convict
speaker: Creed
line: Oh, it's okay. I've got tons of them. You like that? Goo-goo-goo-goo?

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Pam-a-lama-ding-dong. Listen, you're cute. There is no gettin' around it. So... I don't know if you like country music, but I was thinking maybe one of these days we could drive out to a field, crank up some tunes, smoke a few Macanudos... maybe even toss a disk around. Utway ooday ooyay inkthay, Ampay?

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Wow... I--

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Shh. Think about it. I'll hit you back.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Wow. That was... wow.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let's go!

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Michael, it's freezing out.

title: The Convict
speaker: Phyllis
line: I can't feel my toes.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Why don't we... pump some iron? Anyone wanna... pump up?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: What is that, like... five pounds?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: It's uh... two and a half. I'm not going for bulk, I'm going for tone.

title: The Convict
speaker: Stanley
line: I'm going back inside.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Yeah, it's... freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you've got about... twenty-seven minutes of rec time.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Yeah, in the rec room.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Ah. A ten inch black and white?

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Actually, our TV was bigger than that one.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: These people don't realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Oh. Andy. I thought of one last tact you can take with Pam.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Yeah.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Quick question - do you play the guitar?

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: I play the banjo.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Hold on, let me think about that, yes, that'll work. But can you sing in a sexy high falsetto voice?

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: You know I can, my man.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Yup. That's perfect.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Hey.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Hey.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: I'm gonna go get my banjo out of my car.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Perfect.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: What is going on?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: ...I'm messing with Andy. I'm sending him to all the women in the office with... just... terrible information on how to get them to go out with him.

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: I love it. I want in. Who's the target?

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: ...Oh, you know what? ... It was... gonna be Pam, but...

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Perfect. What do I do? Just give me an assignment.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Uh, you know what though? I feel like I already sicked him on Pam... we'll give her a break. Let's think of someone else.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better... than... here. And none of can say "Boo" because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there's somebody I'd like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like . I'm prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Do you really expect us to believe you're somebody else?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?!  All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that's just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody's bitch. Oh, and you.  You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don't drop the soap! Don't drop the soap!

title: The Convict
speaker: Ryan
line: Michael, please.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Where... did you learn all of this?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Internet.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: So, not prison.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I'm saying. It's not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: What'd you do, Prison Mike?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: I stole. ... And I robbed. And I kidnapped... the... president's son. And held him for ransom.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: That is... quite the rap sheet, Prison Mike.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: And I nevah got caught, neither.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Well, you're... in... prison, but, mmhmm.

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: Wow. Prison sounds horrible.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.

title: The Convict
speaker: Dwight
line: Prison Mike. What's the very very worst thing about prison?

title: The Convict
speaker: Angela
line: Don't encourage him, Dwight.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: The worst thing about prison was the... was the Dementors. They... were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they'd come down, and they'd suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!

title: The Convict
speaker: Karen
line: Demen-Dementors like in Harry Potter?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: No, not Harry Potter. ... There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who... have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody's bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. 'Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life.  So. What do you think? It doesn't sound so great, does it?

title: The Convict
speaker: Pam
line: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.

title: The Convict
speaker: Martin
line: Yeah, that... wasn't really... at all my experience. There were certain elements of what you performed, I've seen on television. But it didn't remind me of my time in prison.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go.

title: The Convict
speaker: Jim
line: Okay, Michael. Come on. Let us out.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it's like to have freedom. And if this doesn't bother them, then I am out of ideas.

title: The Convict
speaker: Kevin
line: Hey! Let us out of here! Hey! I have--

title: The Convict
speaker: Hannah
line: Shh!

title: The Convict
speaker: Toby
line: This is Toby. Hey Pam. Where are you calling from?

title: The Convict
speaker: Toby
line: Michael. Why's everyone locked in the conference room?

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.

title: The Convict
speaker: Toby
line: Well, you're going to have to let 'em out. Or... or I will.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.

title: The Convict
speaker: Toby
line: You know they're teasing you. I mean... obviously, this is... a much nicer place than an actual prison. We get paid to be here. We go home afterwards and have social lives. We have... we have parties here. They're teasing you. To be funny.

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don't you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!

title: The Convict
speaker: Michael
line: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford... to a convict, to... my friend. Back to a convict. Then to... a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to... a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.

title: The Convict
speaker: Andy
line: So we've been told, and some choose to believe it, I know they're wrong, wait and see, 'cause one day we'll find it, the ainbowray onnectionkay, the lovers, the dreamers, and meeee...
